title: Felix
content: Procurator of Judea at the time of Paul’s arrest by the Roman military authorities (
). He investigated the case and heard Paul speak in his own defense (

) but put off giving any decision, his reason being that he had “more exact knowledge concerning the Way”: he knew more about the case and about Christianity than the prosecutors had told him. He hoped Paul would have offered him some bribe; but none being offered on his recall from Judea, he left the Apostle still in prison. See
